Miles Sound System SDK 6.1c

Shelving Equalizer Filter

Discussion

This filter is boosts or cuts the frequencies under the low frequency by the low gain and monotonically increases the gain with the frequency. It is useful for controlling the base and treble in a sample.

Preferences:

"ShelvingEQ LowFreq": Low shelf frequency. Range: 20.0 to 20000.0 Hz.

"ShelvingEQ LowGain": Boost / Cut amount. Range: -18.0 to 18.0 dB.

"ShelvingEQ HighFreq": High shelf frequency. Range: 20.0 to 20000.0 Hz.

"ShelvingEQ HighGain": Boost / Cut amount. Range: -18.0 to 18.0 dB.


Group: Digital Filter Services
Related Sections: Parametric Equalizer Filter
